1.text: And Job will add to lift up his parable, and say,

2.text: Who will give me as the months of old, as the days God will watch me?

3.text: In his causing his light to shine upon my head, before his light I shall go through darkness;

4.text: As I was in the days of my ripeness, in the intercourse of God upon my tent;

5.text: In the Almighty being yet with me, my youths round about me;

6.text: In washing my goings with butter, and the rock will pour out with me streams of oil;

7.text: In my going forth to the gate upon the city, in the street I shall prepare my seat.

8.text: The young men saw me and hid themselves, and the old men rose up and stood.

9.text: Chiefs held back in words, and they will put the hand to the mouth.

10.text: The voice the leaders hid, and their tongue was joined to their palate.

11.text: If the ear heard, and it will pronounce me happy; and the eye saw, and it will testify to me:

12.text: For I shall deliver the poor crying, and the orphan, and none helping to him.

13.text: The praise of him perishing will come upon me, and I shall cause the heart of the widow to rejoice.

14.text: I put on justice and it will clothe me: my judgment as an upper garment and a turban.

15.text: Eyes was I to the blind one, and feet to the lame was I.

16.text: I was a father to the needy, and the contention I knew not I shall search it out.

17.text: And I shall break the biterâ€™s teeth of the evil one, and I shall cast the prey from his teeth.

18.text: And saying, I shall expire with my nest I shall multiply days as the sand.

19.text: My root opened to the waters, and the dew will lodge upon my foliage.

20.text: My glory new with me, and my bow will be changed in my hand.

21.text: To me they heard, and they waited, and they will be silent for them at my counsel.

22.text: After my words they will not repeat, and my speech will drop upon them.

23.text: And they waited for me as the rain, and they opened wide their mouth for the latter rain.

24.text: I shall laugh at them, they will not believe; and the light of my face they will not cast down.

25.text: I shall choose their way, and I shall sit the head, and I shall dwell as king in the troop, as he shall comfort those mourning.
